main event: A bright, white light, larger than a star, was observed in the sky over Forsyth, Montana for about 30 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as being round in shape and compared in size to various objects like a basketball, silver dollar, or grapefruit.
The object's color changed from bright white to red as it moved farther away.
The object was detected on airborne radar and ground radar, in addition to being visually observed.
The radar tracking indicated the object was traveling at an estimated speed of 6,000-8,000 mph.
The object disappeared below the horizon after being observed for about 30 minutes.
sighted object: a bright, white light larger than a star
witnesses: Military personnel, including Lt. Capt. Miller, Capt. Cooper, and Lt. Neel
